titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:12 +0000.

did.abstract: The collection contains appraisals for properties located 211-221 Duffield Street and 110-114 Willoughby Street by Edmund B. Brooks, 201-221 Duffield Street and 106-114 Willoughby Street by William A. Stewart, and 201-221 Duffield Street and 106-114 Willoughby Street by Jacques O. Tuchler. Included with the appraisals are photograpsh and maps of the properties. The appraisals were conducted in relation to the urban renewal and redevelopment efforts underway in Downtown Brooklyn during this period.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Downtown Brooklyn real estate appraisals, 1980.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1980.
